newsitem.title: USA: PictureTel sees Q2 small operating loss.
newsitem.headline: PictureTel sees Q2 small operating loss.

text.p: PictureTel Corp said Monday it expects to report revenue in the range of $110 million to $115 million and a small operating loss for the second quarter.
The company said it is too early to forecast net results.
In the second quarter of 1996, the company said it reported revenue of $116 million and earnings per share of $0.24.
Analysts had expected the telecommunications software company to earn $0.10 per shr in the second quarter, according to First Call.

The company issued a news release saying it experienced unexpectedly soft demand during the last two weeks of the quarter, a period that was expected to represent about 40 percent of the total revenue for the quarter.
Such weakness occurred in both the United States and European operations and includes all product lines, the company said.
PictureTel said it believes the weakness is due in part to market confusion regarding the rapid pace of technology change.
PictureTel said expected results also reflect a continuing shift in the company's product mix and lower overall average selling prices.
"Such weakness is expected to continue for the next several quarters," the company said.
"In response to this lower-than-expected demand, the company is evaluating all aspects of its operations and will reduce its cost structure in the third quarter," the company said.
PictureTel said it will announce its complete financial results for the second quarter on July 15.
A company spokesman declined to say whether PictureTel will lay off employees as part of its planned cost cutting.
"We're going to look at all the available ways to reduce costs," the spokesman said. "There could be charges related to the cost cutting actions, but that has not yet been determined."
